channel.title: Adding Santa, to only give ONE present
channel.description:
I add a public int, which was
public int gift = 0 ;
Then whatever goes next, but nothing works? I need some help. So when you speak to Santa, you get a present and after you speak with him again, he says "Oh, someone is being greedy this year!" (LOL) I got the dialogue part perfect, not the present thing though. Thanks.

Anything will be appreciated…

item.title: Adding Santa, to only give ONE present
item.dc:creator: @ProjectDiabolus ProjectDiabolus
item.description:
@ProjectDiabolus wrote:

Well… add the int (public int recievedGift = 0;) into Player.java

Then in client.java search for like… sec lemme see.

("character-rights = "

Then under it add like…

				[code]} else if (token.equals("ReceivedGift")) {
					receivedGift = Integer.parseInt(token2);[/code]

Then search character-rights again and add this to all of it,
characterfile.write("RecievedGift = ", 0, 20); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(recievedGift), 0, Integer.toString(recievedGift).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Then compile and add like…

Idk if this is right so i’ll probably get laughed at, because i’m typing this up right now and its 2:06 in the morning…

[code]public static void receivedGift(int i) {
switch(i) {
case 1:
addItem(xxxx, xxxx);
break;

	case 2:
		sendMessage("You can only get one gift, sorry!");
		break;

}
[/code]
Then in your NPC Click void add like…

else if(NPCID == xxx) {
recievedGift();
}

You’ll most likely get errors, but post them here and i’ll see if I can help…
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 05, 2009, 06:08:29 pm[/size][hr]I hope I wrote up that switch statement right… LOL

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Santa, to only give ONE present
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

You need to do the things the comments say.

So explained. You need to add your Santa code into the first part of the if statement where the comment says. Then in the bottom half, the part that doesn’t give the items and says “You already have this!”. Then of coarse you need to save and load this from the players files when they logout/login. The reason for the last part would be so it doesn’t allow players to log out and get another present.

Read full topic

break;[/quote][/quote]

item.source: Adding Santa, to only give ONE present

item.title: Adding Santa, to only give ONE present
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

That will only work while you are logged in, it will not save which is what you will want.
Why not declare a boolean instead of an int?

	public boolean receivedGift = false;

Then

	/*
	 * On player load; load the information and set receivedGift to the value loaded.
	 * On player save; save the value of the receivedGift.
	*/
	
	if(!receivedGift) {
		//Santa Clause gives you gift
		receivedGift = true;
	}
	else {
		//You already have the gift!
	}

Now keep in mind when you try to load the value of the players status on receiving the item. You will want to check if it is null input before you set the value of receivedGift, because you will probably get a null pointer if you don’t.

PS: While typing this I read the posts posted while I was typing, and noticed xx qwertyuiop xx posted the boolean thing too. So I will post anyways.

Read full topic
